Put<S>5279</S> them<S>846</S> in mind<S>5279</S> to be subject<S>5293</S> to principalities<S>746</S> and<S>2532</S> powers<S>1849</S>, to obey magistrates<S>3980</S>, to be<S>1511</S> ready<S>2092</S> to<S>4314</S> every<S>3956</S> good<S>18</S> work<S>2041</S>,
To speak evil of<S>987</S> no man<S>3367</S>, to be<S>1511</S> no brawlers<S>269</S>, but gentle<S>1933</S>, shewing<S>1731</S> all<S>3956</S> meekness<S>4236</S> unto<S>4314</S> all<S>3956</S> men<S>444</S>.
For<S>1063</S> we ourselves<S>2249</S> also<S>2532</S> were<S>2258</S> <S>453</S> sometimes<S>4218</S> foolish<S>453</S>, disobedient<S>545</S>, deceived<S>4105</S>, serving<S>1398</S> divers<S>4164</S> lusts<S>1939</S> and<S>2532</S> pleasures<S>2237</S>, living<S>1236</S> in<S>1722</S> malice<S>2549</S> and<S>2532</S> envy<S>5355</S>, hateful<S>4767</S>, and hating<S>3404</S> one another<S>240</S>.
But<S>1161</S> after<S>3753</S> that the kindness<S>5544</S> and<S>2532</S> love<S>5363</S> of God<S>2316</S> our<S>2257</S> Saviour<S>4990</S> toward man<S>5363</S> appeared<S>2014</S>, <sup>love: or, pity</sup>
Not<S>3756</S> by<S>1537</S> works<S>2041</S> of<S>1722</S> righteousness<S>1343</S> which<S>3739</S> we<S>2249</S> have done<S>4160</S>, but<S>235</S> according to<S>2596</S> his<S>846</S> mercy<S>1656</S> he saved<S>4982</S> us<S>2248</S>, by<S>1223</S> the washing<S>3067</S> of regeneration<S>3824</S>, and<S>2532</S> renewing<S>342</S> of the Holy<S>40</S> Ghost<S>4151</S>;
Which<S>3739</S> he shed<S>1632</S> on<S>1909</S> us<S>2248</S> abundantly<S>4146</S> through<S>1223</S> Jesus<S>2424</S> Christ<S>5547</S> our<S>2257</S> Saviour<S>4990</S>; <sup>abundantly: Gr. richly</sup>
That<S>2443</S> being justified by<S>1344</S> his<S>1565</S> grace<S>5485</S>, we should be made<S>1096</S> heirs<S>2818</S> according to<S>2596</S> the hope<S>1680</S> of eternal<S>166</S> life<S>2222</S>.
This is a faithful<S>4103</S> saying<S>3056</S>, and<S>2532</S> these things<S>4012</S> <S>5130</S> I will<S>1014</S> that thou<S>4571</S> affirm constantly<S>1226</S>, that<S>2443</S> they which have believed<S>4100</S> in God<S>2316</S> might be careful<S>5431</S> to maintain<S>4291</S> good<S>2570</S> works<S>2041</S>. These things<S>5023</S> are<S>2076</S> good<S>2570</S> and<S>2532</S> profitable<S>5624</S> unto men<S>444</S>.
But<S>1161</S> avoid<S>4026</S> foolish<S>3474</S> questions<S>2214</S>, and<S>2532</S> genealogies<S>1076</S>, and<S>2532</S> contentions<S>2054</S>, and<S>2532</S> strivings about<S>3163</S> the law<S>3544</S>; for<S>1063</S> they are<S>1526</S> unprofitable<S>512</S> and<S>2532</S> vain<S>3152</S>.
A man<S>444</S> that is an heretick<S>141</S> after<S>3326</S> the first<S>3391</S> and<S>2532</S> second<S>1208</S> admonition<S>3559</S> reject<S>3868</S>;
Knowing<S>1492</S> that<S>3754</S> he that is such<S>5108</S> is subverted<S>1612</S>, and<S>2532</S> sinneth<S>264</S>, being<S>5607</S> condemned of himself<S>843</S>.
When<S>3752</S> I shall send<S>3992</S> Artemas<S>734</S> unto<S>4314</S> thee<S>4571</S>, or<S>2228</S> Tychicus<S>5190</S>, be diligent<S>4704</S> to come<S>2064</S> unto<S>4314</S> me<S>3165</S> to<S>1519</S> Nicopolis<S>3533</S>: for<S>1063</S> I have determined<S>2919</S> there<S>1563</S> to winter<S>3914</S>.
Bring<S>4311</S> Zenas<S>2211</S> the lawyer<S>3544</S> and<S>2532</S> Apollos<S>625</S> on their journey<S>4311</S> diligently<S>4709</S>, that<S>2443</S> nothing<S>3367</S> be wanting<S>3007</S> unto them<S>846</S>.
And<S>1161</S> let<S>3129</S> ours<S>2251</S> also<S>2532</S> learn<S>3129</S> to maintain<S>4291</S> good<S>2570</S> works<S>2041</S> for<S>1519</S> necessary<S>316</S> uses<S>5532</S>, that<S>3363</S> they be<S>5600</S> not<S>3363</S> unfruitful<S>175</S>. <sup>maintain: or, profess honest trades</sup>
All<S>3956</S> that are with<S>3326</S> me<S>1700</S> salute<S>782</S> thee<S>4571</S>. Greet<S>782</S> them that love<S>5368</S> us<S>2248</S> in<S>1722</S> the faith<S>4102</S>. Grace<S>5485</S> be with<S>3326</S> you<S>5216</S> all<S>3956</S>. Amen<S>281</S>. <sup>It was written<S>1125</S> to<S>4314</S> Titus<S>5103</S>, ordained<S>5500</S> the first<S>4413</S> bishop<S>1985</S> of the church<S>1577</S> of the Cretians<S>2912</S>, from<S>575</S> Nicopolis<S>3533</S> of Macedonia<S>3109</S>.</sup>
